intro: Anacamptis pyramidalis f. serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering pyramidal orchid, is a rare and distinctive orchid species native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its tall, spike-like inflorescence that bears numerous pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its blooming period is later in the year compared to other members of the species, usually occurring from late summer to early autumn. The subspecies is noted for its horticultural interest and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
